This is a problem I have. I've been brought up that you should always finish your plateful because it's the polite thing to do.

The difference is that my Mum actually adhered to this, and it has helped me immensely in my life now.
If you know you've mucked up, my Mum has always maintained that she will help me whatever, and do her darndest to make the punishment as low as possible. Now living in boarding college environment, it has been exactly the same with the pastoral management, especially our Deputy Headmaster Pastoral, who happens to be ex military, a former welfare officer at the rank of WO2. He maintains that he will also support us in any problem that we might have and do his damndest to make the punishment as low as possible because we owned up, but that we would never get off scot-free, because he said he doesn't believe in that.

That is actually a type of anesthesia. You remain conscious, but you have pain receptors knocked out and the drug had the side effect of knocking out memory too. I think they use it in some neurosurgery cases, in which they put you completely under to remove the part of the skull they need to, then bring you round partially so they know they haven't killed some part important.

Alright! Edexcel history, I can help with this.
Figures - ballpark is generally fine. There are some you need to know fully, but in most cases you are fine with ballparking it.
Be good on your dates. Month and year is pretty much essential. Day helps too. For instance, off the top of my head, the Reichstag fire was on 27th February 1933. Total reparations: 6.6 billion.
Also, work on exam techniques and know exactly what the examiner is looking for. Be articulate in your writing if you want good SPAG marks. Its always great if you correctly use a word that the examiner is probably going to have to look up.
Things like that you need to know. I can PM you my discord ID if you want. I'm in year 12 and didn't drop a UMS in history last year.
The key to English Lit is to over think everything. Analyse a passage, then analyse it again.
I'm in year 12, studying maths, DT, politics and Physics. If you want my discord ID I might be able to help out with some stuff.

WRITING.TITLE: Nick and Judy: my thoughts
WRITING.TEXT:
From browsing this sub recently I have got the impression that many people think that nick and Judy will become romantically involved at some point in the near (canon) future.
In my head, this doesn't seem like it would be a great place for the story to go. Throughout the film it seems evident that their relationship is built on trust and is purely a friendly relationship. I feel as if there would be biological 'things' ingrained in the different species that sort of stops any sort of sexual attraction. You can relate that to real life: interspecies friendships are not unheard of, but they are always purely friendships.
Have I got the right idea here, or is it just the wishful thinking of a minority?

Hence why I put life limiting in there. If it is something relatively minor that's really only an inconvenience, then fine. But if it is something that would warrant round the clock care and/or extended stays in hospital, then it is fundamentally unethical. My mother works in children's continuing care, and she often tells me of how the NHS has to spend hundreds of thousands of pounds to look after children who would be lucky to see their 16th birthday. In a time when budgets are being slashed left, right and center, there must be better places the money could be spent that would better benefit society as a whole.
I routinely sin and I cuss, though I try not to take the Lord's name in vain.
Of course, at the end of the day. But if they do not take the warnings of doctors regarding having a child, they should not expect state or charity support.

I respect your views, but I disagree with them.
I am a Christian, and the thing with my faith is that an open mind took me away from God, then an open mind took me back to God. That being said, I have faith in God, but I am a terrible Christian.
That is precisely my point. If you know, in any circumstance, that you will not be able to give a child a full and proper life, you should not have a child.
It is unethical for someone to reproduce if they knowingly carry or suffer from a life limiting genetic disorder or condition.

This kind of kid is one who has been allowed to get away with stuff.
Friday I had the pleasure of looking after my two nephews. Now, if it is just myself, my younger sister and my dad, they are as good as gold.
As soon as my brother in law (their Dad) is around, all hell breaks loose because he absolutely panders to their whims. You can't hit a kid for misbehaving and then expect them to not dish out the same crap to their peers. He doesn't know how to dish out a proper punishment and stick by his decision. It pisses me off to no end because someone with that attitude should never have had a kid, let alone two. Kids need boundaries, there needs to be a line and they need to know when they've crossed it, and the punishment for crossing it needs to be enforced and not dropped out on 30 minutes after you give it too them.
Sorry about that, needed to blow off some steam.

I can shed some light on what it's like to have to do this. The summer before last we adopted a rescue Springer spaniel. Immediately we began to see issues. The only time he seemed to be happy was when he was in a small confined space and when he was outside he was almost completely uncontrollable. To begin with, for the first few days, we thought that this was completely understandable, given that he's a new dog in a new environment. Until he went for another dog, as in on its back, going for the jugular. My dad hauled him off him, and that was it. He went back the same day, and it soon came to light that we had been misinformed about the dog's background. He'd been trained to run as a gun dog and be a working Springer, not as a family pet, so one could see that the fault was not ours.
I'd be interested to hear what you think.
